verbose_text: These findings are in line with previous reports that beta-adrenergic receptor antagonism prevents both learning of the spatial environment of the holeboard and learning facilitated LTP in the CA1 region and as a result, the re-exposure to the holeboard is perceived as if the environment has never been explored before.
evidence: beta-adrenergic receptor antagonism prevents both learning of the spatial environment of the holeboard and learning-facilitated LTP
